original_title: CSE surpasses 13000 index points in anticipation of positive corporate financial results
original_body_lines: Stock market activities which were very positive yesterday, surpassed 13000 index points due to an anticipation of favourable corporate financial results, market analysts said.
Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 122 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 37.84 points.

Turnover stood at Rs 4.29 billion with three crossings. Those crossings were reported in HNB, which crossed 6.2 million shares to the tune of Rs 1.43 billion and its shares traded at Rs 230, Overseas Realty 14.3 million shares crossed for Rs 265 million; its shares traded at Rs 18.50 and LOLC Holdings 95000 shares crossed for Rs 43.1 million; its shares sold at Rs 458.50.

In the retail market top six performing companies that contributed to the turnover were; Sampath Bank R 140 million (1.56 million shares traded), HNB Rs 135.5 million (584 million shares traded), Brown’s Investments Rs 128 million (20 million shares traded), JKH Rs 113.7 million (5.3 million shares traded), Dipped Products Rs 111 million (2.68 million shares traded) and Commercial Credit and Finance Rs 109.5 million (2.5 million shares traded). During the day 132 million share volumes changed hands in 18939 transactions.
It is said that the banking sector was a bit active along with the manufacturing sector.
Yesterday, the rupee was trading weaker at Rs 292.65/75 to the US dollar from 292.55/75 to the US dollar the previous day, dealers said, while bond yields were down.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 was quoted at 11.12/18 percent. A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 was quoted at 11.58/60 percent. A bond maturing on 15.06.2029 was quoted at 11.95/12.00 percent.
